original_description: Replaces highly conserved leucine, disrupts proton conduction between external side of membrane and c-ring; corresponds to L169P in human MT-ATP6 (m.9032T>C) found in patients with NARP (Neuropathy Ataxia Retinitis Pigmentosa); cells have reduced oxidative phosphorylation capacity, elevated ROS production and hyperpolarization of mitochondrial inner membrane; mutant enzyme assembles correctly, is mostly inactive; intragenic suppressors L186S, H114Q, I118T restore function to varying degrees
